001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005
006import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.integration.BaseAbstractUnivariateIntegrator;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.integration.RombergIntegrator;
008import org.immutables.value.Value;
009
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
013
014import io.github.ai4ci.functions.Coordinates.DuplicateResolution;
015import io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions;
016import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
017
018/**
019 * Empirical probability distribution constructed from sample data or from x /
020 * F(x) pairs.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * Main purpose: provide cumulative, density, quantile and sampling
024 * functionality for empirically observed variables. The implementation fits a
025 * monotonic spline on a transformed scale and exposes convenient accessors for
026 * mean, median, density and random sampling.
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * Downstream uses: consumed by in-host configuration and calibration routines
030 * (for example {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.InHostConfiguration} and
031 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.Calibration}) and by initialisers that need
032 * empirical sampling behaviour.
033 *
034 * @author Rob Challen
035 */
036@Value.Immutable
037@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableEmpiricalDistribution.class)
038@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableEmpiricalDistribution.class)
039public interface EmpiricalDistribution extends Distribution, Serializable {
040
041        /**
042         * Number of knots to use when fitting the spline. If the number of data
043         * points exceeds this value, the data will be downsampled to this number of
044         * points to ensure a smooth fit and to avoid overfitting. If the number of
045         * data points is less than or equal to this value, the data will be used as
046         * is without downsampling.
047         *
048         */
049        static int KNOTS = 50;
050
051        /**
052         * Convenience factory that builds an empirical distribution from raw sample
053         * data using a default link function.
054         *
055         * @param data samples used to estimate the distribution
056         * @return an immutable empirical distribution fitted to the samples
057         */
058        public static ImmutableEmpiricalDistribution fromData(double... data) {
059                return fromData(LinkFunction.NONE, data);
060        }
061
062        /**
063         * Construct an empirical distribution from sample data using the supplied
064         * link function for transformation prior to fitting.
065         *
066         * @param link the link function applied to the sample values prior to
067         *             fitting
068         * @param data the raw samples used to build the empirical distribution
069         * @return an immutable empirical distribution fitted to the samples
070         */
071        public static ImmutableEmpiricalDistribution fromData(
072                        LinkFunction link, double... data
073        ) {
074
075                Arrays.sort(data);
076                var out = ImmutableEmpiricalDistribution
077                                .builder();
078
079                var meanH = Arrays.stream(data).map(link::fn).average().getAsDouble();
080                var varH = Arrays.stream(data).map(link::fn)
081                                .map(d -> Math.pow(d - meanH, 2)).average().getAsDouble();
082
083                var min = link.invFn(meanH - 5 * Math.sqrt(varH));
084                var max = link.invFn(meanH + 5 * Math.sqrt(varH));
085
086                out.setMinimum(min);
087                out.setMaximum(max);
088
089                if (data.length > KNOTS) {
090
091                        var step = ((float) data.length) / KNOTS;
092                        var x = new double[KNOTS - 1];
093                        var y = new double[KNOTS - 1];
094                        for (var i = 1; i < KNOTS; i++) {
095                                double ix = i * step;
096                                var i0 = (int) Math.floor(ix);
097                                var i1 = (int) Math.ceil(ix);
098                                if (i0 == i1) {
099                                        x[i - 1] = data[i0];
100                                } else {
101                                        x[i - 1] = data[i0] * (i1 - ix) + data[i1] * (ix - i0);
102                                }
103                                y[i - 1] = ((double) i) / (KNOTS);
104                        }
105                        out.setX(x);
106                        out.setCumulativeProbability(y);
107                } else {
108                        // use the data as is
109                        var y = new double[data.length];
110                        for (var i = 0; i < data.length; i++) {
111                                y[i] = (i + 1.0) / (data.length + 1.0);
112                        }
113                        out.setX(data);
114                        out.setCumulativeProbability(y);
115                }
116                out.setLink(link);
117                return out.build();
118
119        }
120
121        /**
122         * Baseline an odds-like function to produce a probability distribution by
123         * scaling so that the product odds * density integrates to one.
124         *
125         * @param odds the odds-like empirical function to baseline against this
126         *             density
127         * @return a probability distribution function derived from the supplied odds
128         */
129        default EmpiricalFunction baselineOdds(EmpiricalFunction odds) {
130                var tmp = new RombergIntegrator(
131                                0.0001, 0.0001,
132                                BaseAbstractUnivariateIntegrator.DEFAULT_MIN_ITERATIONS_COUNT,
133                                RombergIntegrator.ROMBERG_MAX_ITERATIONS_COUNT
134                );
135                var total = tmp.integrate(
136                                100000, x -> odds.value(x) * this.getDensity(x), this.getMinimum(),
137                                this.getMaximum()
138//          Math.max(this.getMinimum(), odds.getMinimum()),
139//          Math.min(this.getMaximum(), odds.getMaximum())
140                );
141
142                return ImmutableEmpiricalFunction.builder().setLink(this.getLink())
143                                .setX(odds.getX())
144                                .setY(Arrays.stream(odds.getY()).map(y -> y / total).toArray())
145                                .build();
146        }
147
148        /**
149         * Return the cumulative distribution value at the supplied x.
150         *
151         * @param x the point at which to evaluate the CDF
152         * @return the cumulative probability F(x) in the unit interval
153         */
154        @JsonIgnore
155        default double getCumulative(double x) {
156                return Conversions
157                                .expit(this.getLogitLinkCDF().interpolate(this.getLink().fn(x)));
158        }
159
160        /**
161         * The cumulative probabilities corresponding to {@link #getX()}.
162         *
163         * @return an array of cumulative probabilities in the unit interval
164         */
165        double[] getCumulativeProbability();
166
167        /**
168         * Compute the density at the supplied x using the derivative of the fitted
169         * spline and the link function.
170         *
171         * @param x the point at which to evaluate the density
172         * @return the density f(x) at the point x
173         */
174        @JsonIgnore
175        default double getDensity(double x) {
176
177                if ((this.getMinimum() >= x) || (this.getMaximum() <= x)
178                                || !this.getLink().inSupport(x)) {
179                        return 0;
180                }
181
182                // density is differential of the function:
183                // expit(spline(link(x)))
184                // = expit'(spline(link(x))) * spline'(link(x)) * link'(x))
185
186                return
187                // expit'(spline(link(x))
188                LinkFunction.LOGIT.derivInvFn(
189                                this.getLogitLinkCDF().interpolate(this.getLink().fn(x))
190                ) *
191                // spline'(link(x))
192                                this.getLogitLinkCDF().differential(this.getLink().fn(x)) *
193                                // link'(x)
194                                this.getLink().derivFn(x);
195        }
196
197        /**
198         * The link function applied to the domain when fitting the spline.
199         *
200         * @return the link function used for fitting and inversion
201         */
202        @Override @Value.Default
203        default LinkFunction getLink() { return LinkFunction.NONE; }
204
205        /**
206         * The quantile function is the inverse of the CDF. By fitting the spline on
207         * the logit-transformed cumulative probabilities, we can easily derive the
208         * quantile function by inverting the spline and applying the inverse link
209         * function.
210         *
211         * @return a spline interpolator representing the quantile function
212         */
213        @JsonIgnore @Value.Lazy
214        default SplineInterpolator getLinkLogitQuantile() {
215                return this.getLogitLinkCDF().generateInverse();
216        }
217
218        /**
219         * The spline is fitted on the transformed scale to ensure monotonicity and
220         * to allow for flexible support. The link function transforms the x values
221         * to a scale suitable for fitting, while the logit transformation of the
222         * cumulative probabilities ensures that the fitted function can capture
223         * probabilities in the unit interval without boundary issues.
224         *
225         * @return a spline interpolator representing logit(F(X)) as a function of
226         *         link(X)
227         */
228        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
229        default SplineInterpolator getLogitLinkCDF() {
230                Coordinates tmp = ImmutableCoordinates.builder().setX(this.getX())
231                                .setY(this.getCumulativeProbability()).setXLink(this.getLink())
232                                .setYLink(LinkFunction.LOGIT).setIncreasing(true)
233                                .setResolveDuplicates(DuplicateResolution.MAX)
234                                .setXMin(this.getMinimum()).setXMax(this.getMaximum()).build();
235                return SplineInterpolator
236                                .createMonotoneCubicSpline(tmp.getHx(), tmp.getHy());
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * Maximum support value for the distribution.
241         *
242         * @return the maximum domain value for which the distribution is defined
243         */
244        double getMaximum();
245
246        /**
247         * Maximum support used internally by derived methods. This mirrors
248         * {@link #getMaximum()} and is provided for clarity in templates.
249         *
250         * @return the upper support bound
251         */
252        @Override @Value.Derived @JsonIgnore
253        default double getMaxSupport() { return this.getMaximum(); }
254
255        /**
256         * Compute the mean of the distribution using numerical integration.
257         *
258         * @return the expected value (mean) of the distribution
259         */
260        @JsonIgnore @Value.Lazy
261        default double getMean() {
262                var tmp = new RombergIntegrator(
263                                0.001, 0.001,
264                                BaseAbstractUnivariateIntegrator.DEFAULT_MIN_ITERATIONS_COUNT,
265                                RombergIntegrator.ROMBERG_MAX_ITERATIONS_COUNT
266                );
267                return tmp.integrate(
268                                100000, x -> x * this.getDensity(x), this.getMinimum(),
269                                this.getMaximum()
270                );
271        }
272
273        /**
274         * Convenience accessor for the median.
275         *
276         * @return the 0.5 quantile (median)
277         */
278        @JsonIgnore
279        default double getMedian() { return this.getQuantile(0.5); }
280
281        /**
282         * Minimum support value for the distribution.
283         *
284         * @return the minimum domain value for which the distribution is defined
285         */
286        double getMinimum();
287
288        /**
289         * Minimum support used internally by derived methods. This mirrors
290         * {@link #getMinimum()} and is provided for clarity in templates.
291         *
292         * @return the lower support bound
293         */
294        @Override @Value.Derived @JsonIgnore
295        default double getMinSupport() { return this.getMinimum(); }
296
297        /**
298         * Return the p-th quantile of the distribution.
299         *
300         * @param p a probability in [0,1]
301         * @return the quantile corresponding to p
302         */
303        @JsonIgnore
304        default double getQuantile(double p) {
305                return this.getLink().invFn(
306                                this.getLinkLogitQuantile().interpolate(LinkFunction.LOGIT.fn(p))
307                );
308        }
309
310        /**
311         * The x coordinates used to construct the empirical cumulative.
312         *
313         * @return an array of x values (in ascending order) used for the CDF
314         */
315        double[] getX();
316
317        /**
318         * Sample a random value from the empirical distribution using the default
319         * sampler.
320         *
321         * @return a random draw from the distribution
322         */
323        @Override @JsonIgnore
324        public default double sample() {
325                var rng = Sampler.getSampler();
326                return this.sample(rng);
327        }
328
329        /**
330         * Sample a random value using the supplied {@link Sampler} instance.
331         *
332         * @param rng the random number generator to use
333         * @return a random draw from the distribution
334         */
335        @Override @JsonIgnore
336        default double sample(Sampler rng) {
337                return this.getLink().invFn(
338                                this.getLinkLogitQuantile()
339                                                .interpolate(LinkFunction.LOGIT.fn(rng.nextDouble()))
340                );
341        }
342}
